SEARCH
Package graph.project.bacon

Class BaconGraph

java.lang.Object
graph.MyUndirectedGraph<BaconNode>
graph.project.bacon.BaconGraph
All Implemented Interfaces:
UndirectedGraph<BaconNode>
public class BaconGraph extends MyUndirectedGraph<BaconNode>
Represent an undirected graph of connected actors/actresses, movies and tv-shows.

  • Field Details

    • KEVIN_BACON

      public static final BaconNode KEVIN_BACON
      Represent Kevin Bacon

  • Constructor Details

    • BaconGraph

      public BaconGraph(Path filePath) throws ParseException, IOException
      Reads all lines from a file and from that generates a graph of actors, movies, and tv-shows. Excepted structure of data file is first a line that starts with a <a> tag followed by the name of actor or actress, that line is then followed by any amount of new lines starting with <t> tag and has the name of whatever the actor/actress was featured in. The file should repeat this pattern until end of file
      Parameters:
      filePath - the path to a file
      Throws:
      ParseException - if a line in the file doesn't start with either a "<a>" or "<t>" tag
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs reading from file. For more information, see Files.readAllLines(java.nio.file.Path)

  • Method Details

    • getInclusiveBaconNumber

      public int getInclusiveBaconNumber(BaconNode node) throws NoSuchElementException
      Calculates the inclusive (non-actor nodes) Bacon number for a given node in the graph. This is equivalent to the length of the shortest path between Kevin Bacon and the node because the Bacon number is defined as the minimum number of links between Kevin Bacon and the specified node. For more information, see Six Degrees of Kevin Bacon.
      Parameters:
      node - The node for which to calculate the Bacon number.
      Returns:
      The Bacon number of the specified node, including non-actor nodes.
      Throws:
      NoSuchElementException - If the specified node is not part of the graph.

    • getExclusiveBaconNumber

      public int getExclusiveBaconNumber(BaconNode node) throws IllegalArgumentException, NoSuchElementException
      Calculates the exclusive (non-actor nodes) Bacon number for a given node in the graph. This is equivalent to the length of the shortest path between Kevin Bacon and the node because the Bacon number is defined as the minimum number of links between Kevin Bacon and the specified node. For more information, see Six Degrees of Kevin Bacon.
      Parameters:
      node - The node for which to calculate the Bacon number.
      Returns:
      The bacon number of the specified node using exclusively actors/actresses
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the node is not representing an actor
      NoSuchElementException - if the node is not a vertex in the graph

    • findPathBetween

      public List<BaconNode> findPathBetween(BaconNode start, BaconNode end) throws NoSuchElementException
      Preforms a search on the graph to find the shortest path between two nodes. To find the bacon number of one the parameters replace the other parameters with KEVIN_BACON
      Parameters:
      start - the node to be used as start for path search. This node will be put as the first element in the returning path list
      end - the node to be used as stop for path search. This node will be put as the last element in the returning path list
      Returns:
      an ordered list with the shortest path between the start and end nodes. Method returns an empty list if there is no path between start and end
      Throws:
      NoSuchElementException - if either one of the parameters is not a vertex of this graph

    • depthFirstSearch

      public List<BaconNode> depthFirstSearch(BaconNode start, BaconNode end) throws NoSuchElementException
      Description copied from interface: UndirectedGraph
      Gär en djupet-först-sökning efter en väg mellan två noder. Observera att denna metod inte använder sig av viktinformationen.
      Specified by:
      depthFirstSearch in interface UndirectedGraph<BaconNode>
      Overrides:
      depthFirstSearch in class MyUndirectedGraph<BaconNode>
      Parameters:
      start - startnoden.
      end - slutnoden.
      Returns:
      en lista över alla noder på vägen mellan start- och slutnoden. Om ingen väg finns är listan tom.
      Throws:
      NoSuchElementException

    • isValidPath

      public boolean isValidPath(List<BaconNode> nodes) throws IllegalArgumentException, NoSuchElementException
      Checks whether an ordered list of nodes is ordered in such a way to create a path from the first node to the last
      Parameters:
      nodes - a list of nodes
      Returns:
      a boolean value of whether the list is a valid path from first to last element
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the list of nodes passed as arguments is null
      NoSuchElementException - if one of the nodes in the list is not a part of this graph
      IllegalArgumentException
